features.title: Video Upload UI
features.description: Create a file upload interface that allows users to select and upload video files (mp4, webm, mov) from their device. Display upload progress and validation feedback.
tests: Unit test: Upload component renders with file input
Unit test: File validation rejects non-video files
Unit test: File validation accepts valid video formats
E2E test: User can select a video file and see upload progress
Manual: Verify video file selection works in browser, shows file name and size

features.title: Video Storage and Database Model
features.description: Create Prisma schema for Video model (id, userId, filename, url, duration, uploadedAt) and implement server-side upload handler that saves video files and stores metadata in database.
tests: Unit test: Video model can be created in database
Unit test: Video upload handler validates file type and size
E2E test: Uploaded video is stored and retrievable
Manual: Verify video file appears in database after upload

features.title: Video Player Component
features.description: Build a video player component using HTML5 video element with play/pause, seek, and frame-by-frame navigation controls. Display current time and duration.
tests: Unit test: Video player component renders with controls
Unit test: Play/pause functionality works
E2E test: User can play, pause, and seek through video
Manual: Verify smooth playback and frame navigation in browser

features.title: Video List/Management Page
features.description: Create a page that displays all videos uploaded by the current user. Show video thumbnails, titles, upload dates, and provide delete functionality. Link to individual video tracking pages.
tests: Unit test: Video list component fetches and displays user videos
Unit test: Delete button triggers delete action
E2E test: User can view their video list
E2E test: User can delete a video from the list
Manual: Verify video list displays correctly with thumbnails

features.title: YouTube URL Input
features.description: Create a form field that accepts YouTube URLs. Validate URL format and extract video ID. Display a placeholder message about future processing capability.
tests: Unit test: YouTube URL validation accepts valid URLs

E2E test: User can input a YouTube URL and see validation feedback

features.title: Tracking Point Marker
features.description: Implement a canvas overlay on the video player that allows users to click to place tracking points at specific frames. Store point coordinates (x, y) and frame number.

E2E test: User can click on video to place a tracking point

features.title: Multi-Point Tracking Across Frames
features.description: Enable users to track the same point across multiple frames. Allow frame navigation and point placement/updating. Store tracking data as an array of (frame, x, y) coordinates.
tests: Unit test: Multiple tracking points can be stored for same object
Unit test: Points are associated with correct frame numbers
E2E test: User can navigate frames and place multiple points
Manual: Verify tracking points persist when navigating between frames

features.title: Scale Calibration UI
features.description: Create a UI for users to set the real-world scale. Allow users to draw a line on the video and input the real-world distance in meters. Calculate pixels-to-meters conversion ratio.
tests: Unit test: Scale calibration calculates pixels-to-meters ratio
Unit test: Scale data is stored correctly
E2E test: User can draw a scale line and input distance
Manual: Verify scale line drawing works smoothly on video

features.title: Tracking Data Export
features.description: Implement export functionality that allows users to download tracking data as CSV. Include columns: frame, time (seconds), x (pixels), y (pixels), x (meters), y (meters) if scale is set.
tests: Unit test: Export function generates correct CSV format
Unit test: CSV includes all required columns
E2E test: User can export tracking data and download CSV file
Manual: Verify CSV opens correctly in spreadsheet application

features.title: Position vs Time Graph

Unit test: X/Y toggle switches graph axes correctly

features.title: Velocity Calculation and Graph

tests: Unit test: Velocity calculation is correct for sample data
Unit test: Velocity handles edge cases (first/last frames)
Unit test: Velocity converts to m/s when scale is available
E2E test: User can view velocity vs time graph
Manual: Verify velocity calculations match expected physics results

features.title: Acceleration Calculation and Graph
features.description: Calculate acceleration from velocity data (a = Δv/Δt) and create an acceleration vs time graph. Display acceleration in m/s² if scale is set.
tests: Unit test: Acceleration calculation is correct for sample data
Unit test: Acceleration handles edge cases
Unit test: Acceleration converts to m/s² when scale is available
E2E test: User can view acceleration vs time graph

features.title: Trajectory Path Visualization

features.title: Basic Error Handling and Validation
features.description: Add error handling for video loading failures, invalid file types, missing scale calibration, and insufficient tracking points. Display user-friendly error messages.

Manual: Verify all existing database queries in the application function correctly

features.title: Line of Best Fit and Mathematical Model for Graphs
features.description: Add buttons to each graph (position vs time, velocity vs time, acceleration vs time) that allow users to generate a line of best fit. Users can select the fit type (linear, quadratic, polynomial, etc.). The line of best fit is displayed overlaid on the graph. A separate button opens a panel showing the mathematical model with the equation, R² value, and coefficients, suitable for physics class analysis.

Unit test: Line of best fit calculation works for polynomial regression
Unit test: R² value is calculated correctly
Unit test: Coefficients are calculated correctly for selected fit type
Unit test: Mathematical model panel displays equation, R², and coefficients
E2E test: User can select fit type and generate line of best fit on position graph
E2E test: User can view mathematical model panel with statistics
E2E test: Line of best fit appears overlaid on the graph
Manual: Verify line of best fit visually matches data trend
Manual: Verify mathematical model statistics are accurate for physics analysis

features.title: Fullscreen Modal for Data Table and Graph Cards
features.description: Add fullscreen icon buttons in the top-right header of both the data table card and the graph section card. Clicking the button opens a modal dialog overlay that expands the card content to fullscreen using framer-motion animations. The data table modal displays the same table content at a larger size. The graph section modal preserves the currently active tab (Position/Velocity/Acceleration) and allows switching between tabs within the modal. The modal can be closed via a close button (X icon), pressing ESC, or clicking the backdrop.
tests: Unit test: Fullscreen button renders in data table header
Unit test: Fullscreen button renders in graph section header
Unit test: Modal opens when fullscreen button is clicked
Unit test: Modal closes when close button is clicked
Unit test: Modal closes when ESC key is pressed
Unit test: Modal closes when backdrop is clicked
Unit test: Graph modal preserves active tab when opened
Unit test: Graph modal allows tab switching when open
E2E test: User can open data table in fullscreen modal
E2E test: User can open graph section in fullscreen modal
E2E test: User can switch graph tabs within fullscreen modal
E2E test: User can close modal using all three methods (close button, ESC, backdrop)
Manual: Verify framer-motion expansion animation is smooth
Manual: Verify modal content is properly sized and scrollable if needed

features.title: Coordinate System Axis Configuration
features.description: Add a button (similar to "Set Scale") that allows users to configure a custom x-y coordinate system on the video. Users can place the origin by clicking, drag the origin to move it, and drag a grabber handle on the x-axis (to the right of the origin) to rotate the axis. The axis visibility can be toggled on/off. Once configured, all tracking point coordinates are transformed to this new coordinate system, and graphs display data relative to the new origin and orientation. The axis configuration (origin position and rotation angle) is saved to the database and persists across sessions.
tests: Unit test: Coordinate transformation function correctly converts tracking points from video coordinates to axis-relative coordinates
Unit test: Axis configuration can be saved to database with origin x, y, and rotation angle
Unit test: Axis configuration can be loaded from database
Unit test: Axis visibility toggle shows/hides axis on canvas
E2E test: User can click button to activate axis configuration mode
E2E test: User can place axis origin by clicking on video
E2E test: User can drag origin point to move axis
E2E test: User can drag x-axis grabber handle to rotate axis
E2E test: User can toggle axis visibility on/off
E2E test: Axis configuration persists after page reload
E2E test: Tracking points are transformed to new coordinate system after axis is set
Manual: Verify axis appears correctly with x and y lines and grabber handle
Manual: Verify smooth dragging and rotation interactions
Manual: Verify graphs show transformed coordinates correctly
